summary: ghost in the shell was certainly not perfect in how it handled themes of disability and cyborg modification (calling no-wireless...
body: ghost in the shell was certainly not perfect in how it handled themes of disability and cyborg modification (calling no-wireless mode “autistic mode”, anyone?), but it was still good overall and i loved it, so seeing the cyberpunk 2077 writers comparing themselves to ghost in the shell? please

body:
Hello world, #celebratemondays with the brandnew new news video with your man Mr. News Man is out now 👓 [https://youtu.be/rGugSeVf6oA]

What’s trendy right now? Which topics we will discuss?

-E3 convention in L.A and some titles that the publisher release next yeatv

-Keanu reeves and cyberpunk 2077

-Infinity war and marvel avengers the game

-Something around the nintendo switch

-The new update from assassins creed odyssey

-The new consoles xbox “scarlett” and playstation 5

-ShepardChris planed to visit the yunicon and maybe the nippon nation and vienna comic con

What’s true behind this new news?

Find it out with me your man, Mr. News Man 👓

summary: What the fucking fuck are the developers of Cyberpunk 2077 smoking? The way they talk about nudity and “bodily impurities” are...
caption:
What the fucking fuck are the developers of Cyberpunk 2077 smoking?

The way they talk about nudity and “bodily impurities” are equivalent to damn weebs who to go lengths to justify their masturbation material and have a superficial understanding of the media they consume at best.

blog.name: angelofberlin2000
blog.title: Like a Rose trampled on the ground
blog.description:
In addition to the pain and the exhaustion, he recalled how waiting on the cross between takes became tedious. To fight the boredom, he listened to music on headphones. One particular song called "Above All" (Like a Rose ...) by Michael W. Smith helped him through his most difficult moments.

"It arrived when I was confused and angry. I didn't think I could go on. The song described how Jesus was rejected and alone. That thought took me to a place — it opened an interior door that held me while on the cross," an emotional Caviezel explained. "The experience of feeling rejected and alone as all those around me laughed while drinking their hot coffees, oblivious to what was occurring. Jesus must have felt like this — forsaken, rejected, alone, and despised. It helped me pray in a very deep way — to pray without words, to pray from the heart. The discomfort, the loneliness, the split shoulder, the raw flesh all forced me into the arms of God because I had nowhere else to go for a performance I knew I was unable to create."
Jim Caviezel, Shamelessly Catholic

summary: Would you be alright with sharing some details about Vesper and Vermillion? They look awesome, and way you dissect characters is...
question: Would you be alright with sharing some details about Vesper and Vermillion? They look awesome, and way you dissect characters is super fascinating so i'd love to hear more about characters you've created yourself 😀
answer:
anon I’m ready to raze civilizations for you

so I’ve kept away from hdc-ing too much since the details of the game are still super vague but here’s some background stuff I’ve tentatively come up with! (subject to change)

VESPER:

Ah, Vesper. Well, let’s just start that she’s an absolute chaotic good. She tries her best but fails more often than not. She’s a dreamer and wants to make something of herself but often gets in trouble because of her eagerness to prove herself. She grew you up mostly on the streets, looking out for herself from a young age since her father—while not abusive—never took care of her properly. Vesper has a good brain and interacts with people easily but has trouble connecting with them in a meaningful way. Her bravery (her father called it stupidity) caused her to lose her legs when she was 14 in an accident involving a stray dog and a street race. The dog lived and so did she, but they both now have prosthetics for legs. She kept the stray and called him Shadow since he won’t leave her side after the incident. During the months it took her to heal (they didn’t have much money for fancy procedures that would have escalated the healing process), Vesper discovered Johnny Silverhand and his band. She fell in love with his music and the spark of life it brought back in her. She would spend days humming his songs under her breath and would often—badly—sing it to healing Shadow as well. She has a problem of falling a little in love with people she meets every day. Others either find her endearing or completely unbearable from the get-go. She finally ran away from home on her 18th birthday after her father threatened her with physical violence.

-PINTEREST-

VERMILLION:

Vermillion is the exact opposite of Vesper in almost every way. She grew up in a rich family, constantly in the shadow of her older brother. She was a sickly child from birth, and has grown up suffering from chronic pain and migraines that often left her incapacitated. But for every day spent sick, her mind didn’t grow dull. While physically weak, her mind became terrifyingly sharp. After an accident that left her parents dead, her brother seriously injured, and her permanently scarred, she started plotting. When her brother started recovering, Vermillion proposed that he passes their father’s business to her since she had a more critical mind for it. Her brother, considering her a real threat, arranged for her to be locked away, deeming her “violent and unstable”. Years of incorrect medication, isolation, pain and neglect have left her cold and driven, barren of much compassion for anyone but herself. She has no trouble stepping over anyone and everyone to get what she wants. Which in this case is enough power to never be overlooked or in pain again. After six long years of being imprisoned, she finally manages to manipulate one of her guard “friends” to help her escape. That’s her first kill—no loose ends. Vermillion has a vendetta, a brother to kill, and power to gain and she won’t stop till every inch of Night City belongs to her. By whatever means necessary. 

-PINTEREST-

summary: Cyberpunk 2020 Creator Mike Pondsmith Responds to Cyberpunk 2077 Transgender Controversy
title: Cyberpunk 2020 Creator Mike Pondsmith Responds to Cyberpunk 2077 Transgender Controversy
body:
Cyberpunk 2020 Creator Mike Pondsmith Responds to Cyberpunk 2077 Transgender Controversy

The creator of Cyberpunk 2020, Mike Pondsmith, who is also consulting on CD Projekt Red’s Cyberpunk 2077, recently responded to the Cyberpunk 2077 transgender controversy.

Pondsmith took to the Cyberpunk 2077 subreddit to respond to a thread about an in-game advertisement that a number of people viewed as transphobic for sexualizing a character with male genitalia on a female body.

Pondsmith…

View On WordPress

blog.name: fake-geek-girl
blog.title: Journal of a one time muse
blog.description: Rising from the depths of the internets, like some sort of cthonic siren in a bad cybperpunk novella.

tags: do i really have to get into this in this the year of our lord 2019??
summary: Your Ship (of Theseus) Has Already Sailed
title: Your Ship (of Theseus) Has Already Sailed
body:
Before i get into this, let me start by saying that i am by no means an expert in genetics, trans folks or humanism, disability rights, ethics, metaphysics, or other sorts of neo-Aristotelian hoodlie-hoo.

With that out of the way…

Something that’s been angrily worming its way through my mind since i read about the most recent piece of Cyberpunk 2077 fuckery is the response from bros who have jumped to the defense of CDPR. Like, i get that it’s the internet, and that everyone with a keyboard who has encountered the logical fallacies cards fancies themselves a philosopher. But let’s be real, in this, the year of our lord 2019, how is it that people are jumping all over themselves to explain how The Ship of Theseus is so deep, you like, just don’t get it.

My dudes, bros, and brosettes. This is 20-sodding-19, and if my idiot ass has read enough about the life cycle of cells, telomere chains, genetic expression and so-on to get that, hey! Our bodies are functionally replaced, whole cloth, over the course of seven years. And while sure, there are suggestions for how things should be laid out to keep a generally you-ish meat mecha shambling through this glorious fuck-up of a universe, it’s one that has changed. With your environment, experiences, each heart break and exultation. There is nothing left of your original self but memories genetic and otherwise.

So what if people just happen to have things over-written suddenly, and with wires, metal, and sundry, rather than DIYing through consumption of food, water, air, and a little cellular know how? Your body adjusts, your self adjusts, and you sail on through this life. What causes the most problems for that self, that body old-and-new, is the society that surrounds it, and how said society perceives and treats it.

And if the reaction i’ve seen is any indication, it’s not the machine that makes one a monster in this case, it’s the men that surround them.

Our bodies are functionally replaced, whole cloth, over the course of seven years. And while sure, there are suggestions for how things should be laid out to keep a generally you-ish meat mecha shambling through this glorious fuck-up of a universe, it’s one that has changed. With your environment, experiences, each heart break and exultation. There is nothing left of your original self but memories genetic and otherwise.

So what if people just happen to have things over-written suddenly, and with wires, metal, and sundry, rather than DIYing through consumption of food, water, air, and a little cellular know how? Your body adjusts, your self adjusts, and you sail on through this life. What causes the most problems for that self, that body old-and-new, is the society that surrounds it, and how said society perceives and treats it.

And if the reaction i’ve seen is any indication, it’s not the machine that makes one a monster in this case, it’s the men that surround them.
trail.content:
Before i get into this, let me start by saying that i am by no means an expert in genetics, trans folks or humanism, disability rights, ethics, metaphysics, or other sorts of neo-Aristotelian hoodlie-hoo.

With that out of the way…

Something that’s been angrily worming its way through my mind since i read about the most recent piece of Cyberpunk 2077 fuckery is the response from bros who have jumped to the defense of CDPR. Like, i get that it’s the internet, and that everyone with a keyboard who has encountered the logical fallacies cards fancies themselves a philosopher. But let’s be real, in this, the year of our lord 2019, how is it that people are jumping all over themselves to explain how The Ship of Theseus is so deep, you like, just don’t get it.

My dudes, bros, and brosettes. This is 20-sodding-19, and if my idiot ass has read enough about the life cycle of cells, telomere chains, genetic expression and so-on to get that, hey! Our bodies are functionally replaced, whole cloth, over the course of seven years. And while sure, there are suggestions for how things should be laid out to keep a generally you-ish meat mecha shambling through this glorious fuck-up of a universe, it’s one that has changed. With your environment, experiences, each heart break and exultation. There is nothing left of your original self but memories genetic and otherwise.

So what if people just happen to have things over-written suddenly, and with wires, metal, and sundry, rather than DIYing through consumption of food, water, air, and a little cellular know how? Your body adjusts, your self adjusts, and you sail on through this life. What causes the most problems for that self, that body old-and-new, is the society that surrounds it, and how said society perceives and treats it.

And if the reaction i’ve seen is any indication, it’s not the machine that makes one a monster in this case, it’s the men that surround them.

title: ES PROBABLE QUE KEANU REEVES TAMBIÉN CANTE EN CYBERPUNK 2077 #Evento #Gamer #Juegos #Consolas #E3 #E32019 #CorporativoArcanos #Masukomi #SutaArcanos #Noticias
body:
ES PROBABLE QUE KEANU REEVES TAMBIÉN CANTE EN CYBERPUNK 2077 #Evento #Gamer #Juegos #Consolas #E3 #E32019 #CorporativoArcanos #Masukomi #SutaArcanos #Noticias

El actor Keanu Reeves también ha formado parte de una banda de rock en el pasado. Esa experiencia podría serle útil en el juego de Cyberpunk 2077, ya que su personaje es una leyenda de la música en el juego e incluso podríamos escucharlo interpretar algunas canciones.

Reeves interpretará el papel de Johnny Silverhan, quien será un personaje muy importante en el juego, siendo incluso el segundo…
